title: Unit 2 Checkpoint: Equations & Inequalities
description: Summative checkpoint assessing mastery of solving one-step, two-step, and multi-step equations, equations with variables on both sides (including special cases: no solution and identity), and one-variable inequalities with the sign-flip rule.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: Identifying the operation on the variable and applying the correct inverse operation (add/subtract, multiply/divide) to isolate it
Box the variable term, think outside the box (deal with constants first), opposites make zero, side by side gotta divide; handling fractions as division
Distributing before combining like terms, simplifying each side fully before using inverse operations
Moving variable terms to one side and constants to the other; recognizing no-solution (false statement) and identity (true statement) special cases
Solving inequalities using the same steps as equations, with emphasis on flipping the inequality sign when multiplying or dividing by a negative number

assessmentProblems.question: Solve: x + 12 = -5
assessmentProblems.answer: Subtract 12 from both sides: x + 12 - 12 = -5 - 12 → x = -17. Check: -17 + 12 = -5 ✓.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve: x/4 = -9
assessmentProblems.answer: Multiply both sides by 4: x = -9 * 4 → x = -36. Check: -36/4 = -9 ✓.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve: 3x - 7 = 20
assessmentProblems.answer: Add 7 to both sides: 3x = 27. Divide both sides by 3: x = 9. Check: 3(9) - 7 = 27 - 7 = 20 ✓.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve: (x + 5)/3 = -2
assessmentProblems.answer: Multiply both sides by 3: x + 5 = -6. Subtract 5 from both sides: x = -11. Check: (-11 + 5)/3 = -6/3 = -2 ✓.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve: 5x - 7 = 3x + 9
assessmentProblems.answer: Subtract 3x from both sides: 2x - 7 = 9. Add 7 to both sides: 2x = 16. Divide by 2: x = 8. Check: 5(8) - 7 = 33 and 3(8) + 9 = 33. 33 = 33 ✓.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve: 3(x + 4) = 2(x - 1) + x + 14. Identify the type of solution.
assessmentProblems.answer: Distribute: 3x + 12 = 2x - 2 + x + 14. Combine like terms on the right: 3x + 12 = 3x + 12. Subtract 3x from both sides: 12 = 12. This is always true, so the equation is an **identity** — the solution is all real numbers.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve: 2(x + 5) = 2x - 3. Identify the type of solution.
assessmentProblems.answer: Distribute: 2x + 10 = 2x - 3. Subtract 2x from both sides: 10 = -3. This is a false statement — the equation has **no solution**.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve: 7x - 4 > 2x + 16
assessmentProblems.answer: Subtract 2x from both sides: 5x - 4 > 16. Add 4 to both sides: 5x > 20. Divide by 5: x > 4. Check: try x = 5: 7(5) - 4 = 31 and 2(5) + 16 = 26. Is 31 > 26? Yes ✓. Try x = 3: 7(3) - 4 = 17 and 2(3) + 16 = 22. Is 17 > 22? No ✗.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve: -4(x - 2) + 3 >= 19
assessmentProblems.answer: Distribute: -4x + 8 + 3 >= 19. Combine like terms: -4x + 11 >= 19. Subtract 11 from both sides: -4x >= 8. Divide by -4 and **flip the inequality sign**: x <= -2. Check: try x = -3: -4(-3 - 2) + 3 = -4(-5) + 3 = 20 + 3 = 23. Is 23 >= 19? Yes ✓. Try x = 0: -4(0 - 2) + 3 = 8 + 3 = 11. Is 11 >= 19? No ✗.
